reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me begin by saying: THIS GAME IS AWFUL.

As a huge fan of underappreciated indie games, the fact that this kind of garbage gets greenlit over far superior and more deserving games is actually pretty disheartening.

[EARLY ACCESS REVIEW]

Pros:

+Quirky art direction
+Interesting premise (basically Kirby minus the enemy swallowing)
+It has steam cards

Cons:

-Bland gameplay
-Unresponsive controls
-Awful U.I.
-Poor controller integration
-Unpolished and disgracefully underdeveloped (even for an early access title)

Frankly, this does not even qualify as a game in any right as it stands - stay away at all costs.

TLDR - Terrible game offers ~10 minutes of terrible gameplay; don't give these people money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, you get two versions of this game. The original 2014 version that looks like it's created using MS Paint and uses up for jumping. Then there's the new version which looks slightly better and introduces the worst ever implementation of wall jumping. The controls in both versions are really bad and in an insta-death platformer that's not a good thing at all. Those problems are severe, but if the game had at least any interesting levels or something else that would warrant playing the game, I wouldn't mind the control problems that much. Unfortunately both versions have bland, boring and unimaginative level with only one saving grace: You can turn into monsters to overcome certain parts of the levels. While this idea is quite good, the combination of controls and poor level design just make it absolutely frustrating to use.

The one interesting aspect of the game is hindered by a poor presentation, horrible controls and boring level design. Really not worth your time and there has to be a landslide of improvements (given there is already a second version) before this game is worth your time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had opportunity to test this game in early access, so I'm giving my review of this game.
Let's begin with advantages, we got here:
-good, catchy music
-interesting graphics
-couple various enemies
-some different levels to play (not so many at the moment)
-CARDS (For collectors)
And those are the main benefits, i could see. Now let's focus on disadvantages, because Blob From Space" got a large amount of those.
For example:
-bad controls
-keyboard bugs
-cheats system: you can't choose the level
recommended:
because you need to know password for individual one
-sometimes you can fall out from the edges
-a little boring levels
---------and many more

In my opinion this game is not worth to be bought for full price

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nYou know a game is bad when you have to remind yourself to re-open it like 3 times after closing it because it was so horrible just to get the trading cards.  For new players as of writing this review, do yourself a favor and play the 2014 version upon loading, the new BETA is just one map to test the wall-jumping, the 2014 version at least has playable content and achievements, etc.  It's a game that probably would have felt at home in the early years of DOS games but feels totally out of place in 2015 with it's horrible clunky controls.  If they can take the feel of the BETA and implement the idea from the 2014 version it might actually float, but right now it's a sinker and a stinker.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not ready for public consumption

This game appears to be closer to a planning or prototyping stage. It really should not be up on steam at the moment and definitely not for $5.99 USD.

Please make the 2014 version start as the default version. The default mode (Latest public build) will ultimately kill your chances at anything if you leave it as the default game that is started when users play it for the first time. At least get the main menu working before releasing it! Also, the text input on the 2014 'cheats' screen is all wonky if you type too fast.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

this is not a very enjoyable game, at least for me.

the gameplay is okay, but unappealing graphics and repetitive music make it really hard to want to play it for a long period of time.

pros:
+ steam cards
+ the option to turn off that awful music before it gives you a major headache

cons:
- music (consisting of a two second loop that keeps repeating over and over and over again)
- bland level and character design
- rounded platform edges, which you keep sliding off of all the time

also, a continue would be nice. you only get three lives and when you're out of them you have to start from the beginning.

i think this game definitely has some potential, but in the current state it's just not worth it.

you could try it out if it's in a bundle or on sale, but i certainly don't recommend buying this game for the full price (which is currently 5,49‚Ç¨).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you have patience, like a challenge or just want a game with achievements that will make you think then this is a good title to pick up.

If you want a quick 100%, something easy or maybe something to unwind after work then you should probably stay far away. Be warned, the controls & limited lives will really induce the rage as mentioned on the store page.
Good luck!

On another note, the developer (JosPlays) is also very active in the discussions. He answered all my posts in a pretty timely fashion that i can remember, and it always saved me from further achievement frustrations.

You have to CONSTANTLY tap to fly if you are in the shape of one the flying aliens. It is more awkward on the controller if you add the fact that the left stick is up/down and the right is L/R, it isn't all one stick to move, which is very common sense and normal in controller games. Jump is spastic sometimes, giving you a give burst jump, or at least it seems that way. Transforming causes you to do a little hiccup" and if you are too close to an edge
date: you fall off because of that (which
recommended: with many of the corners rounded
hoursPlayed:
you slip off instead of teetering on the edge). Music gets VERY annoying fast since it is like a 5 second bit on constant repeat.



I REALLY hope this game gets updated with some decent updates

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE 2/27/2015
I am writing this update because I saw they were redoing the game in Unity which I think is great.  The little bit they currently have done in the Beta version is amazing!  It already looks and feels much better.  Can't wait to see the finished remake.
_____________________________________________________________________________________
First of all the game was made on Game Maker.  Also keep in mind this game was made with a $0 budget.

Overall it's a fun and pretty challenging game.
The only problem I see is that the game (in my honest opinion) is not worth $6.
I would recommend to people looking for a new and difficult platformer.
I would no doubt wait till it is on sale though.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know how this game ended up in my library, a bundle? My general stance is to not buy Early Access, so I don't know how to rate them.

I would say to wait until this is properly released, because currently it handles like someone fed your keyboard/controller sugar mixed with meth. A tiny tap is translated as six to seven hundred taps, and it makes the game rather difficult. Difficult in the bad way.

The game spends a great deal of time trying to get the idea across that it is supposed to be super hard, a real rage quit experience, but it's doing it in the way that no one actually wants to experience. Super Meat Boy is a real rage quitter, but that's because it's a challenge in the reflexes and puzzle solving sense. You are using super tight control and intuitive feedback to overcome an experience.

This game just gives you awful controls and next to no feedback on your actions and just says, Well
recommended: it's supposed to be hard!"\n\nSo yeah
hoursPlayed: wait and see if this is eventually released in a playable state."
